alert.note: Alert for Miami (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 7:33AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Johnson KS, Linn KS and Miami. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 AM CDT, the public reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Overland Park, Leawood, Paola, Spring Hill, Osawatomie, Louisburg, La Cygne, Linn Valley, Parker, Fontana, New Lancaster, Beagle, Hillsdale, Wagstaff, Chiles, Bucyrus and Stillwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
